title: Make Openverse – Openverse is a search tool for CC-licensed and public domain content across the internet. – WordPress.org
body:

Make Openverse


Source Code
GitHub Project
Handbook
Good First Issues
 



Hide welcome box



Welcome!
Openverse is a search engine for openly-licensed media. 
The OpenverseOpenverse Openverse is a search engine for openly-licensed media, including photos, audio, and video. Openverse is also the name for the collection of related code repositories that make up the project. find Openverse at https://openverse.org. team builds the Openverse Catalog, APIAPI An API or Application Programming Interface is a software intermediary that allows programs to interact with each other and share data in limited, clearly defined ways., and front-end application, as well as integrations between Openverse and WordPress. Follow this site for updates and discussions on the project.
You can also come chat with us in #Openverse on SlackSlack Slack is a Collaborative Group Chat Platform https://slack.com/. The WordPress community has its own Slack Channel at https://make.wordpress.org/chat/.. We have a weekly developer chat at 15:00 UTC on Tuesdays.
If you’re a new contributor, welcome! Have a look at our good first issues or our guide for new contributors.











 
Zack Krida

6:46 pm on May 1, 2023 



					 
				

Openverse Monthly Priorities Meeting 2023-05-03


OpenverseOpenverse Openverse is a search engine for openly-licensed media, including photos, audio, and video. Openverse is also the name for the collection of related code repositories that make up the project. find Openverse at https://openverse.org. contributors will host a community meeting to discuss priorities for May at 1500 UTC on 2023-05-03.
A sync video chat link will be provided in the #openverse channel of the Making WordPress Chat. We hope to see you there.
You can read the ongoing notes document for these meetings here.Login to Reply

Francisco

8:16 am on April 20, 2023 



					 
				

Community Meeting Recap (2023-04-18)


[Meeting Start]
📝 Agenda
Nothing was pointed out in the agenda, yet two topics were mentioned:
This and this heads up regarding Catalog’s move to the Monorepo.
Shoutout to @dhruvkb‘s work for his great work on done the monorepofication of our service. The catalog integration occurred quickly, and now we’re having positive cross-pollination between the various services.
Due to the empty agenda, the meeting ended a few minutes earlier.
[Meeting End]Login to Reply

Zack Krida

10:13 pm on April 11, 2023 



					 
				

New repository for storing sensitive terms


As part of our Filter and blur sensitive results by term matching #377 project the OpenverseOpenverse Openverse is a search engine for openly-licensed media, including photos, audio, and video. Openverse is also the name for the collection of related code repositories that make up the project. find Openverse at https://openverse.org. team needs a new GitHubGitHub GitHub is a website that offers online implementation of git repositories that can easily be shared, copied and modified by other developers. Public repositories are free to host, private repositories require a paid subscription. GitHub introduced the concept of the ‘pull request’ where code changes done in branches by contributors can be reviewed and discussed before being merged be the repository owner.  https://github.com/ repository created. The group @WordPress/openverse-sensitive-content-reviewers should be administrators of the repository. This repository will house a README and a .txt file containing a list of sensitive terms.
The repository should be called WordPress/openverse-sensitive-terms. It’s possible this repository will be renamed in the future to expand in scope beyond Openverse. 
For more details on the motivation of this project, please see the implementation plan in GitHub.Login to Reply










 
Madison

6:49 pm on April 11, 2023 



Tags: openverse-weekly-community-meeting ( 47 )   
				

Community Meeting Recap (2023-04-11)


[Meeting Start]
📝 Agenda
Reminder: the catalog repository is currently in a code freeze while we wait for the monorepo work & data refresh to run.
Reminder – Please vote and discuss:  Should we combine the “guides” and “references” section in the documentation?
Confirm: Move RFCs into docs site – @zackkrida has opened a draft PR for this effort.
Discussion: Can we use the new project board exclusively?
@olgabulat noted that we have a tracking issue for automation around the new dashboard
We can probably move this over once issues with PRs are automatically moved to in-progress

Discussion: How can we remind reviewers about proposals/discussions, which have different deadlines than PRs?
Folks present agreed that a weekly reminder message of open discussions would be helpful.
@aetherunbound will take on some of the effort around adding new labels & automation for this.

[Meeting End]
#openverse-weekly-community-meetingLogin to Reply
